page.title: 02CUSTOMS
page.content: { {A CURSED FIELD }On Harlyn Farm, above Harlyn Bay, is a field known as Green Close Meadow. A fishwife who lived nearby is said to have cursed the field, so that the eldest son of anyone ploughing the field would die. It is uncultivated to this day. {SHIP WRECKING }Tom Parson's Hut stands on the south side of Booby's Bay. Its one-time occupant was a wrecker who, legend says, tied a lantern to the tail of a donkey, leading the animal along the clifftop, the swaying light misleading ships' captains into thinking that here was an hospitable port. The cottage has been acquired by the National Trust. Booby's Bay is on the west side of Trevose Head.
